Title: Angola LNG shuts down operations for unplanned maintenance, exports impacted
Description: The 5.2 mtpa Soyo LNG export plant in Angola has shut down for essential maintenance, and at least five LNG tankers are idling nearby, unable to load.
Author: JS

Title: EU gas storage ends Q1 2025 below five-year average, above 2021 and 2022 levels
Description: Gas storage levels across the European Union stood below their five-year average at the end of March, reflecting stronger withdrawals driven by weak renewable output, lower gas supply  and several prolonged cold snaps this winter. However, inventories remained slightly higher than at the same point in 2021 and 2022.
Author: CK

Title: US DOE removes curbs to LNG export license extension policy
Description: The U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) has reversed a Biden Administration policy that required proposed LNG projects seeking export license extensions to prove they had begun construction and faced extenuating circumstances, which it said was “standing in the way of unleashing U.S. LNG exports”.
Author: JS

Title: Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG misses Q1 export target, British Sponsor LNG tanker idles nearby
Description: The BP-operated 2.5 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG facility, located on the Mauritania-Senegal border, has yet to ship its first cargo, missing a widely anticipated first-quarter 2025 export timeline.
Author: CK

Title: Romania’s Romgaz seeks approval to establish subsidiary in Moldova for gas supply
Description: Romania’s state-owned gas company, Romgaz, is seeking shareholder approval to establish a subsidiary, Romgaz Furnizare M S.R.L., in Moldova. The proposed subsidiary aims to enhance Romgaz’s natural gas supply operations and expand its market share in the region.
Author: CK
